misc

Class Progress

  • java.lang.Object
    • misc.Progress

  • public class Progress
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains the progress of something. This can be anything as long as it can be counted with an integer and has a known integer end. For example we can count the progress in a tournament if we know that we doe n negotiations in that tournament.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int ALL
      Flag for including all of the above in report
      static int CHAR
      Flag for including a spinner in report
      static int CURRENT_TOTAL
      Flag for including current/total in the reporting (example: 5/20)
      static int ETA
      Flag for including estimate time ahead (ETA) in report (example: ETA: 5 minutes)
      static int PERCENTAGE
      Flag for including percentage in the reporting (example: (25%))

    • Constructor Detail

      • Progress

        public Progress(int total)
        Initializes a new instant of the Progress object. To use timing (ETA), you additionally should call the .start() function as closely to the function to be timed as possible.
        Parameters:
        total - The total amount of progress that can be made

    • Method Detail

      • increment

        public void increment()
        Increases the progress by 1, but never beyond the total progress

      • increment

        public void increment(int n)
        Increases the progress by n, but never beyond the total progress

      • isDone

        public boolean isDone()
        Returns true if this progress is at last state.
        Returns:
        True if current >= total, false otherwise

      • start

        public void start()
        Mark now as the starting point in negotiation

      • getNowNano

        public long getNowNano()
        Gets the nano time passed since start of progress.
        Returns:
        amount of nanoseconds since .start() was called

      • getNowPretty

        public java.lang.String getNowPretty(boolean includeSeconds)
        Gets the time passed as an human readable string.
        Parameters:
        includeSeconds - if true, will print up to seconds. if false, will print up to minutes.
        Returns:
        Time passed since .start() as a string (example: 2 hours, 5 minutes)

      • getTotal

        public int getTotal()
        Get the final number for this progress
        Returns:
        The number up to which to progress

      • getProgress

        public double getProgress()
        Gets the progress as a fraction
        Returns:
        value between 0.0 (not started yet) and 1.0 (done)

      • getProgressString

        public java.lang.String getProgressString(int options)
        Gets the progress string. Will return depending on the used options. use the constant values in this class to generate the options. for example: getProgressString(Progress.ETA | Progress.CURRENT_TOTAL)

        Progress.ETA: Report estimated time ahead Progress.CURRENT_TOTAL: Report current/total Progress.PERCENTAGE: Report percentage done Progress.CHAR: Show spinner char Progress.ALL: All of the above

        Parameters:
        options - See description
        Returns:
        String with the current progress

      • printProgressToConsole

        public void printProgressToConsole(int options)
        Erases previously printed line and prints the progress string. Will print depending on the used options. use the constant values in this class to generate the options. for example: getProgressString(Progress.ETA | Progress.CURRENT_TOTAL)

        Progress.ETA: Report estimated time ahead Progress.CURRENT_TOTAL: Report current/total Progress.PERCENTAGE: Report percentage done Progress.CHAR: Show spinner char Progress.ALL: All of the above

        Parameters:
        options - See description

      • getEta

        public double getEta()
        Gets the estimated time remaining based on the time we used so fare
        Returns:
        estimated time remaining in nano seconds.
